cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest this morning, then turning north and north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coast toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just inland of the South Carolina/North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear–Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River GA, and from Surf City NC to the NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County FL line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Hurricane); Sebastian Inlet FL to Volusia/Brevard County FL line (Tropical-storm); North of Savannah River GA to Surf City NC (Hurricane)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida northward through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional outer-band gusts, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤34 kt probability ≤8%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge threat (surge zone begins north of Sebastian Inlet, well north of PortMiami)
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands, generally <3 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Miami-Dade beaches
